## ğŸ†˜ Quick Help Guide

### Before Posting
1. **ğŸ” Search first** - Your question might already be answered
2. **ğŸ“– Check our [FAQ](/support/faq)** - Common issues are documented
3. **ğŸ”— Review our [quickstart guide](/quickstart)** - Basic setup is covered

### When Posting
1. **ğŸ“ Use clear, descriptive titles**
   - âœ… Good: "React authentication error with OAuth flow"
   - âŒ Poor: "help please" or "doesn't work"

2. **ğŸ“‹ Include relevant context**
   - Framework you're using (React, Vue, Node.js, Python, etc.)
   - Error messages (copy-paste, don't screenshot code)
   - What you've already tried
   - Relevant code snippets

3. **ğŸ·ï¸ Tag appropriately**
   - Use the right discussion category
   - Tag `@mentors` for urgent technical issues
   - Add relevant labels like `frontend`, `backend`, `mobile`, `api`

## ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« Mentorship Program

Tag **`@mentors`** for urgent technical issues. Our mentor team specializes in:

### **Frontend Specialists**
- React/Next.js integration with Open Finance APIs
- Vue.js/Nuxt.js applications
- Angular enterprise solutions
- Mobile development with React Native/Flutter

### **Backend Experts**
- Node.js/Express API development
- Python/FastAPI financial services
- Go microservices architecture
- Authentication and security implementation

### **DevOps & Deployment**
- Cloud deployment (Vercel, Railway, AWS)
- CI/CD pipeline setup
- Docker containerization
- Performance optimization

### **Domain Experts**
- Open Finance regulations and compliance
- Financial API best practices
- Security and data protection
- User experience for financial apps

## ğŸ“… Hackathon Timeline & Support

### **Pre-Hackathon (Setup Week)**
- Environment setup and API testing
- Team formation and project planning
- Mentor office hours: Daily 2-4 PM GMT+4

### **Hackathon Days (Development)**
- 24/7 community support via discussions
- Mentor check-ins every 8 hours
- Emergency help: Tag `@mentors` with `urgent`

### **Demo Prep (Final 24 Hours)**
- Presentation coaching available
- Technical demo troubleshooting
- Submission verification help

## ğŸ† Project Showcase Guidelines

When sharing your project:

### **Include These Details**
- **Project Name & Tagline**
- **Problem it solves** (which Open Finance use case)
- **Tech stack** used
- **Live demo link** (if available)
- **GitHub repository** (public or private with access)
- **Screenshots or demo video**

### **Get Better Feedback**
- Specify what type of feedback you want
- Ask specific questions about features or implementation
- Share your biggest challenges and how you solved them
- Mention what you'd do differently next time

## ğŸ¤ Community Guidelines

### **Be Respectful & Inclusive**
- Welcome developers of all skill levels
- Be patient with beginners - we all started somewhere
- Celebrate diverse approaches and solutions
- Help others when you can!

### **Keep It Relevant**
- Focus on Open Finance, hackathon topics, and related technologies
- Search before posting to avoid duplicates
- Use appropriate discussion categories
- No spam, promotional content, or off-topic discussions

### **Be Helpful**
- Provide context when asking questions
- Share solutions when you figure things out
- Link to relevant documentation
- Follow up on responses to show what worked

## ğŸ¯ Success Tips

### **For Beginners**
- Start with our [starter templates](/templates) for quick setup
- Join the `#beginners` discussion threads
- Don't hesitate to ask "basic" questions - everyone's learning!
- Pair up with more experienced developers

### **For Experienced Developers**
- Share your expertise by helping others
- Showcase advanced implementations
- Contribute to template improvements
- Mentor newer developers

### **For All Teams**
- Document your learning journey
- Share both successes and failures
- Build in public - it helps everyone learn
- Connect with other teams for collaboration

## ğŸš€ Ready to Start?

1. **Introduce yourself** in the comments below
   - Your background and skills
   - What you're hoping to build
   - How you'd like to contribute to the community

2. **Explore existing discussions** to see what others are working on

3. **Ask your first question** or share your project idea

4. **Help someone else** - teaching is the best way to learn
